doc.after: A differential equation is a mathematical equation that relates some function with its derivatives In applications the functions usually represent physical quantities the derivatives represent their rates of change and the equation defines a relationship between the two Because such relations are extremely common differential equations play a prominent role in many disciplines including engineering physics economics and biology
